definitions: To establish a basis for; to found.
To prohibit (an aircraft or pilot) from flying.
To connect (an electrical circuit) to the earth.
To punish (a child or young person) by restricting their activities and privileges.
examples: The theory is grounded in extensive research.
The airline grounded all its 737 MAX planes.
The ship grounded on the sandbar.
Make sure to ground the appliance properly.
My parents grounded me for a month.
